item.title: An insight to Decision Trees
item.description: Introduction Decision trees are supervised learning models utilized for regression and classification. It uses a single tree that can be visualized so we can see the root, sub-roots, leaves, and the way the Tree has decided to predict/classify its final output gives decision trees high interpretability. Types of Decision Trees There are two varieties of Decision Trees based on the dependent variable: Decision Tree Classifier: Here, the dependent feature is categorical, for instance, Diabetic and Non-Diabetic Patient, Fraudulent and non-fraudulent transactions.
